title: Jaylen Brown gives his own take on Boston Tea Party in stream with IShowSpeed
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jaylen Brown teamed up with YouTuber IShowSpeed for a live stream showcasing a tour of Boston.
The duo recreated the Boston Tea Party by humorously dumping buckets of tea into the water.
Brown challenged IShowSpeed to a race in Downtown Crossing, but disputed the result after IShowSpeed claimed injury.

title: Dante Scarnecchia likes what he sees from Patriots rookie Will Campbell
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Will Campbell is set to debut as the Patriots starting left tackle against the Raiders on Sunday.
Dante Scarnecchia praises Campbell's motor, run blocking, and technique as promising for his NFL career.
Campbell received high preseason grades from Pro Football Focus, despite concerns about his arm length.

title: ‘That’s their prerogative’: Mike Vrabel responds to Bill Belichick’s ban on Patriots scouts at UNC
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Mike Vrabel addresses Patriots scouts' reported ban at UNC, stating it's UNC's prerogative to restrict access.
Bill Belichick, now UNC's coach, reportedly bars Patriots scouts, due to frosty relations with Robert Kraft.
Patriots can request film and player information from UNC, as live scouting access is restricted.

title: Woman who was allegedly filmed in the shower at URI is suing the school
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: A URI student is suing the university over being allegedly filmed in a unisex dormitory shower.
The woman accuses URI of negligence and defamation, claiming inadequate security and mishandling of the incident.
The lawsuit names James Paquette, who faces a video voyeurism charge, as the alleged perpetrator.

title: Christian Gonzalez to miss Patriots’ season opener, Will Campbell questionable vs. Raiders
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Christian Gonzalez will miss the Patriots' season opener against the Raiders due to a prolonged hamstring injury.
Rookie left tackle Will Campbell is listed as questionable with an ankle injury for Sunday's game.
Patriots' secondary faces changes with new players like Carlton Davis; the Raiders visit with Geno Smith at quarterback.

title: Jayson Tatum’s Celtics teammate has a positive update on star’s recovery from Achilles tear
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jayson Tatum's teammate Jordan Walsh reports Tatum is progressing well in his recovery from an Achilles injury.
The Celtics have not set a timeline for Tatum's return after his injury during the Eastern Conference Semifinals.
Despite the uncertainty around Tatum, Celtics president Rich Gotham says the team is keeping options open for the season.

title: 5 things to know about the Raiders ahead of Sunday’s matchup against the Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Raiders begin a new era with head coach Pete Carroll and quarterback Geno Smith, reuniting after their time at the Seahawks.
Raiders tight end Brock Bowers set rookie records last year and is projected to continue strong performance in 2025.
Rookie running back Ashton Jeanty, a top draft pick, is favored to win Offensive Rookie of the Year for the Raiders.

title: What does it mean that TreVeyon Henderson is listed 3rd on the Patriots’ depth chart?
author: Aidan Buchanan
bullets: Rookie TreVeyon Henderson is listed as RB3 on the Patriots' depth chart behind Rhamondre Stevenson and Antonio Gibson.
Henderson, a former Ohio State player, impressed in preseason with a 100-yard kick return and an eight-yard touchdown.
Head coach Mike Vrabel plans to continue a running back committee approach, involving Stevenson, Henderson, and Gibson.

title: Here’s what fantasy football experts are saying about Patriots players in Week 1
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Drake Maye is highlighted as a sleeper pick against the Raiders' pass defense, which ranked mid-pack last season.
Rhamondre Stevenson is expected to lead the Patriots in carries during Week 1, despite rookie TreVeyon Henderson's potential.
Stefon Diggs, returning from a 2024 ACL injury, will play in Week 1 and is considered crucial for Drake Maye's performance.

title: Hundred-year book debate: Which 1926 classic still stands the test of time?
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: The Boston Public Library is hosting the Hundred-Year Book Debate focusing on books published in 1926.
Eight 1926 books are contenders, including Hemingway's 'The Sun Also Rises' and Milne's 'Winnie-the-Pooh'.
Readers can vote online until Sept. 27 and attend a live debate on Feb. 10, 2026.
